intro: Orbexilum psoralioides, commonly known as the Mexican burnet, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, fern-like appearance, while its roots are often used in traditional medicine. Orbexilum psoralioides thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for gardens in temperate climates.
